vocabulary.definition: A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically an unwelcome one.
vocabulary.french_definition: Un écart par rapport à ce qui est normal, habituel ou attendu, généralement indésirable.
vocabulary.korean_definition: 보통, 일반적이거나 예상되는 것에서 벗어남, 특히 원하지 않는.
vocabulary.example: The economic crisis was an aberration, not a regular occurrence.

vocabulary.definition: Well-meaning and kindly.
vocabulary.example: She had a benevolent smile that made everyone feel welcome.

vocabulary.definition: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
vocabulary.french_definition: Un mélange de sons durs et discordants.
vocabulary.example: A cacophony of deafening alarm bells.

vocabulary.definition: Make (someone) weak and infirm.
vocabulary.example: A week in bed had debilitated him.

vocabulary.definition: Cheerful and full of energy.
vocabulary.example: She sounded ebullient and happy.

vocabulary.definition: Treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humor.
vocabulary.french_definition: Traiter des sujets sérieux avec un humour volontairement inapproprié.
vocabulary.korean_definition: 심각한 문제를 고의적으로 부적절한 유머로 다룹니다.
vocabulary.example: A facetious comment.

vocabulary.definition: Gather or collect (something, especially information or approval).
vocabulary.french_definition: Rassembler ou collecter (quelque chose, en particulier des informations ou une approbation).
vocabulary.korean_definition: 특히 정보나 승인과 같은 것을 모으거나 수집합니다.
vocabulary.example: The police struggled to garner sufficient evidence.

vocabulary.definition: Unfortunate.
vocabulary.example: The hapless victims of the disaster.

vocabulary.definition: A person who attacks cherished beliefs or institutions.
vocabulary.french_definition: Une personne qui attaque des croyances ou des institutions chéries.
vocabulary.korean_definition: 소중히 여기는 믿음이나 제도를 공격하는 사람.
vocabulary.example: His iconoclastic tendencies led him to challenge the norms.

vocabulary.definition: Place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
vocabulary.french_definition: Placer ou traiter côte à côte pour un effet de contraste.
vocabulary.korean_definition: 대조적인 효과를 위해 가까이 두거나 다룹니다.
vocabulary.example: Black-and-white photos of slums were starkly juxtaposed with color images.

vocabulary.definition: A constantly changing pattern or sequence of elements.
vocabulary.french_definition: Un motif ou une séquence d'éléments en constante évolution.
vocabulary.example: Her dress was a kaleidoscope of colors.

vocabulary.definition: Slow and relaxed.
vocabulary.example: They turned with languid movements.

vocabulary.definition: An independent-minded person.
vocabulary.example: He's always been a bit of a maverick.

vocabulary.definition: Wicked or criminal.
vocabulary.example: The nefarious activities of the organized crime syndicates.

vocabulary.definition: Characterized by vulgar or pretentious display.
vocabulary.french_definition: Caractérisé par un affichage vulgaire ou prétentieux.
vocabulary.example: The ostentatious lifestyle of the rich and famous.

vocabulary.definition: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
vocabulary.example: The pernicious influences of the mass media.

vocabulary.definition: Exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
vocabulary.example: A vast and perhaps quixotic project.

vocabulary.definition: Not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily.
vocabulary.example: She was extremely reticent about her personal affairs.

vocabulary.definition: Having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment.
vocabulary.example: They were sagacious enough to avoid any outright confrontation.

vocabulary.definition: A feeling of fear or agitation about something that may happen.
vocabulary.example: He approached the door with trepidation.
